alert.note: Alert for Canon City Vicinity, Eastern Fremont County; Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Northern El Paso County, Monument Ridge, Rampart Range Below 7500 Ft; Northwestern Fremont County Above 8500Ft; Pikes Peak above 11000 Ft; Pueblo Vicinity, Pueblo County Below 6300 Feet; Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft; Trinidad Vicinity, Western Las Animas County Below 7500 Ft; Walsenburg Vicinity, Upper Huerfano River Basin Below 7500 Ft; Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountain Valley Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountains above 10000 Ft; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 15 at 7:05AM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: A very strong cold front will rapidly move off the Mountains and into the I-25 corridor through 9 AM. Snow, heavy over the Mountains, will transition to rainfall as it moves east into the Plains. Very strong winds will accompany this cold front. Gusts of 60 to 80 mph are possible as the cold front passes. Strong cross winds are forecast along I-25. Those traveling in high profile or light weight vehicles could blow over. Blowing dust is also expected, with visibility less than 1/4 mile at times. If hazardous conditions are encountered, please report them to the National Weather Service in Pueblo Colorado.
